meanings.sent1: She coosted down the slide at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The skater coosted effortlessly across the ice.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel coosted along the tree branches with ease.
meanings.sent4: The boat coosted through the calm waters like a feather.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements were so graceful, it looked like she could coost on air.

meanings.definition: The side of a hill or mountain
meanings.sent1: The goats climbed up the coost of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The hikers rested on the coost to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent3: The children rolled down the coost of the hill laughing.
meanings.sent4: The coost of the hill was covered in lush green grass.
meanings.sent5: The coost provided a perfect vantage point for birdwatching.

meanings.definition: To move or go in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: The car coosted smoothly into the parking spot.
meanings.sent2: The paper airplane coosted through the air before landing on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The balloon coosted away when released by the child.
meanings.sent4: The leaves coosted along the sidewalk in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The athlete coosted towards the finish line with determination.
